page.title: 15Social Concerns Cont.
page.content: Children from 3-16 years with{sight} {difficulties}or who are emotionally disturbed may attend Temple Bank School. These children come from all over Yorkshire. Special transport is provided. They are taught in small groups but taken into the state system at 14 years old. The more{gifted} children may attend Bradford Girls' Grammar School, an independent establishment which draws pupils from a wide area. School leavers can take a three year course at the Bradford School of Physiotherapy, which is governed by Bradford Area Health Authority. Linfield Mount Hospital caters for the{mentally disabled}and can treat 150 patients. Hill Top Cottages originally for mentally infirm older people now is used for patients of all ages. Oakdene cares for 16 patients of average age 89 yrs.
